intro: Dorstenia obtusibracteata, commonly known as the blunt-bracted tortoise plant, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Dorstenia obtusibracteata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soil with minimal water.
